Reviews.Title: “Great place, good value”
Reviews.Author: Gary_n_Kris
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here just for 2-nights after landing at Orlando. Wish we could have stayed longer as we were pleasantly surprised at the amount of space, facilities and quality of the room - we had expected something less just for 2-nights! Pleasant staff on the security gate and check-in etc. We had a 2-bedroom apartment on the second floor (UK first floor!) which had a long kitchen, dining and lounge area - all one room but long and very spacious. It was an ideal place and location to rest before setting off to do lots of driving. Would definitely return but for longer next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind after a day in the parks.”
Reviews.Author: dudelbug914
Reviews.Content: Polynesian Isles is a quiet, peaceful, comfortable place to unwind after a day at Disney or Universal. We exchanged thru RCI for a week in a 2 bedroom unit. Plently of room for a family of 4. The kitchen is well stocked with all the necessary amenities to prepare meals if you choose to dine in. The king bed in the master suite is very comfortable and I'll admit that our first night was probably the "best night's sleep" I've ever had on vacation. The only negative comment I have regarding the room is the need for more bath towels. There was a w/d located outside the front door that we shared with our neighbors in the next unit. We met folks from Michigan that were staying in Phase I and they had a much larger 2 bedroom unit with w/d in room. Now that I know, I will request a Phase I unit in the future. Overall, our unit was clean, quiet and comfortable, so no real complaints. I would definitely stay here again when traveling to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay near Orlando, FL”
Reviews.Author: WannaTravelNeedMoney
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Polynesian Isles for 5 nights.....we wish we could have stayed for 2 weeks (...next time for sure!) Our family of 6, 2A 4K (ages 6, 10, 10 and 13) were well accomodated in the 2 bedroom suite with a beautiful huge master bedroom (loved the ensuite jacuzzi and separate shower!) and spacious second bedroom with full bathroom adjacent. Kitchen was well equipped and the entire suite was beautiful and very comfortable. Free laundry was shared between two suites and was easily accessible. The grounds surrounding the Polynesian were beautifully landscaped. The pool was very clean and the water was warm. Tennis and other activities were available. We had a bit of a reservation mixup, but the apologetic management (Scott and staff) went out of their way to ensure we were looked after and eventually managed to keep us in the same suite. We were very grateful for their efforts. We enjoyed excellent Customer Service and although the time share issue did pop up at check in, we felt no pressure to participate. The Polynesian Isles is the the type of property we look for when we travel: clean, safe, comfortable, quiet and in a good central location. We were very pleased with the Polynesian Isles and look forward to our return visit. With no hesitation, we would stay there again and heartily recommend the Polynesian Isles.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely”
Reviews.Author: Chris L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This place was just perfect as advertised. The room was large and well decorated and there were two bedrooms. It was like an apartment. Everyone we met was friendly and they had lots of activities. The only thing we had an issue with was as others have stated, the walls and floors are not very sound proof. Our first night the person below us called security 3 times and said we were making too much noise. We were trying to be as quiet as possible but they were still able to hear us so if you are sensitive to noise I would request a top floor. The washer and dryer are shared between two units and are not in your unit but are still very nice to have. Very close to Disney, we had a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property - Clean, Well Kept and Inexpensive!”
Reviews.Author: hdhendrix
Reviews.Content: Like most people, when booking a place that you have never stayed at before, there is always that feeling of concern that it won't live up to your expectations. Upon are arrival at the resort, all of my concerns were quickly erased. The grounds were extremely well kept and our 2 bedroom unit was fantastic. Very spacious and most importantly, very CLEAN! Our 3 children were all very happy with the condo, but their real concern was of course the swimming pools! They were not disappointed at all to find that the pool area was very nice as well - heated to a temperature that made swimming enjoyable, very clean water, and the surrounding patio area in great condition. They also enjoyed the other activities that the resort offered: playing shuffle board, shooting hoops and the putting green. Overall, we had a great stay and I would recommend this property to all friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Joe L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I reserved rooms online a month in advance. Got a great rate. Worried it might mean rundown...until we showed up. Very clean, current. Wish I had a master bath like that at my house! My only complaint was the complimentary internet, you get what you pay for. Speeds slower than dial up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Suite! Fabulous property!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polynesian Isles March 5-7, 2012. We were 4 adults and 2 young children in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was gorgeous, very clean, and very roomy. We would go back any time. The pool was very warm (even on a cool day). Kitchen was well-equipped with all the essentials. Do not hesitate to book this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Tons of Space, Super Nice”
Reviews.Author: LouCapo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Polynesian Isles resort last week and were very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience. The grounds are very well maintained, the staff is impeccable, from the front office to the security guards (especially the overnight ones). The rooms are HUGE and very clean. We stayed in phase 1 and I felt the furniture was a little oldish looking but thats a tiny nit-pick.

Reviews.Title: “Small Relaxing Resort”
Reviews.Author: LoriS_H11
Reviews.Content: This property was found to be clean, quiet, and off the beaten path. It took 10 to 15 minutes get to Disney World and SeaWorld. The kitchen was well stocked with just about everything needed to cook healthy meals for my family. A Super Walmart was conveniently located 5 minutes from the resort. It was a pleasure to return 'home' after a busy day at the parks to relax in the hot tub and pool and shake off the park wearies. We were requested to pick up a 'guest services package' or something of that nature, which was really a time-share spiel, but they were dismissed in minutes, and we were not bothered further. The only functional part of the condo that was not optimal was the washer/dryer combo....It steamed the clothes more than washed them as to properly dry, the system would have needed to be vented outside, but this wasn't the case. Not a big deal. We would book there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie J
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean, very spacious, and comfortable. I highly recommended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reliable Resort”
Reviews.Author: cpdowdell
Reviews.Content: My family has been coming here since 1984. They continue to maintain and upgrade everything and it shows. This property could not be better located - between two major routes and off the beaten path. (Either one leads to a Disney road within minutes!) Nice and spacious apartments - with laundry facilities. Great pools and hot tubs.

Reviews.Title: “Small quiet resort”
Reviews.Author: canadadada
Reviews.Content: Aesthetically a very nice resort, rooms are updated and look very tropical and the grounds are very nice. Two decent sized pools and almost every building has it's own hot tub. Stayed the week before Christmas and they had many outdoor decorations throughout. The one drawback it that you have to share the washer and dryer with the people next to you. As it is outside and you use your room key to get into the laundry room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: This was our first family visit to Orlando. We stayed in a two bedroom condo. It was perfect for two adults and a nine and twelve year old. It was close to Disney, Universal, and outlet shopping. Kids enjoyed swimming, basketball, and tennis. Condo was very spacious. Tvs and the kitchen could use some updating. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Such a nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Smilla_SE
Reviews.Content: Our whole family loved this place! We were two adults and one nine year old. Our huge two bedroom apartment were wonderful. We stayed in one of the two floor units, there are two and three floor units. Beds were clean and comfy, sofa and armchair likewise. Table were set really nice when we arrived. Kitchen were really great with everything you could need. Lots of pots and pans, I did not miss a thing! Bathrooms were great, shower terrific! We had a very nice porch with a table and four chairs and two sunbeds, all screened in. Wireless internet worked excellent. Everything are kept really good and it is a clean resort full of nice guests and employees. People who stay here tend to keep after their children, there were never any annoying kids in the pool. It is quiet, I only heard the people above us move around a couple of times, I never heard them talk or their TV. I only had one complaint, they need to buy a machine to clean the carpeting, there were a few small and big stains... The resort is located really good, between Disney World and International Drive. If you stay in Kissimmee (to save a few bucks instead of staying on International Drive, you also get a two bedroom apartment instead of just a hotel room for the same price) this is just great. You have a huge Walmart nearby, Target a few minutes away (by car) and lots of restaurants and gift shops and outlets really close. It is possible to walk about in the neighborhood. We arrived very late and the gate keeper helped us really fast with check in. Gate security were also very good and friendly. I think this is a timeshare resort but we were never asked to attend any sales tour/talk. Very nice! If I am interested I will ask, I do not like if they call and ask several times, so a big plus to their employees. Pools and hot tubes were very clean and warm. You can play tennis, shuffle board, minigolf (a bit small), basketball for free. You park your car just outside your apartment. I would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Only Place For Us!”
Reviews.Author: rticqlate
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at this resort twice, and each time proved to us how much better it is to stay there than at the Disney Resorts. Away from the hustle and bustle, yet closer than some of Disney's own resorts to their theme parks! The 2 bedroom/2bath condos are full of granite and tile with large private balconies. The kitchen and laundry is fully equipped. This year we had a nice jacuzzi tub in the master bedroom en suite. So much nicer than having the kids stay with us in a cramped hotel room!!! The resort has two small scale pools, lakes and waterfalls, they are never crowded and kept clean. The staff and security have always been very helpful and cordial. The "gift bag" is to avoid as it is a timeshare intro, which we have no interest in, just avoid it and they will not badger you...unless your interested!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: Shauna20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks and I truly enjoyed it. The staff are wonderful as well as the amenities. There are different activities you can do on separate nights. I had no issues what so ever with this property. We had a two bedroom condo and I felt right at home. I highly recommend for extended vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Three weeks, and we would have been glad to stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: TenerifeSharon
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful (timeshare) resort, and is small enough to be non-overwhelming and personal, and large enough to have everything you need for a wonderful vacation (two pools, hot tubs, beautiful well-kept grounds, excellent security guards at the gated entry). The area is very quiet, but very convenient to a lot of shopping and many restaurants in the area. We had a large two-bedroom, two-bath apt. for the three weeks of our stay, and arrived to find everything beautifully clean, well set-up and very welcoming. The apt. was perfectly equipped for all needs, and had very comfortable beds and an absolutely HUGE master bathroom with jacuzzi and separate shower. The washer & dryer were shared with the next door apartment. If your apt. is not on the top floor, be prepared to hear your upstairs neighbor walking around his/their apt., as a lot of sound carries down, even with normal footsteps (strangely enough, no sound whatsoever from the neighboring apart on the side). We were located on the 2nd of 3 floors, and I knew -- at any time of day or night -- if there was anybody awake over us. (Only a real problem during the first week, as the family above had 3 children. Not terrible, but sometimes disturbing when the children continually ran from one end of the apt. to the other But, hey, they were also on vacation!) If you need to do some serious internet work during your vacation, you may have some difficulty, as the connection is "spotty" and extremely slow at times. Other than these minor details, our stay was perfect and we would be very happy to have a repeat visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant resort great find”
Reviews.Author: LancashireSkids
Reviews.Content: as most of the other reviews state this is a great place to stay we have been 7 times to florida and this is by far the best resort we have stayed at , all the staff were great and very helpful , you are always unsure when you book somewhere but we were greatly surprised at the condo , massive master bedroom , large lounge and kitchen diner , everything you want is provided , there was nothing better after a long day at the parks etc to get in the hot tub then the pool very nice and very clean , great location for the 192 and very close to all the parks .

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: weloveamerica
Reviews.Content: What great value for money. The condo is massive and so are the bathrooms. 2 great pools both with hot tubs and there are another 2 hot tubs in the grounds. Really huge comfy beds and a full kitchen. Good location just off the 192 and round the corner from a big walmart. very secure with a guard on the entry point checking all cars in and out. Timeshare desk is not pushy, yes they try but if you say you are not interested they leave you alone. We normally stay in a florida home but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough Nice Things About This Resort”
Reviews.Author: joannep2bc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the first phase of this resort Oct.12 - 22 and I can't wait to go back if given the opportunity. I have never stayed at a timeshare resort before so I was thrilled to have a full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and a washer/dryer. I was traveling alone and felt very safe in the area and at the resort. I attended the timeshare presentation and received $100 cash incentive. I did not feel pressured into buying and carried on my way after 2 hours. I was within 15min walking distance to Walmart SuperCenter, 10 min to the flea market and 10 minutes to the local bus to get to and from the parks. I avoid renting cars these days because of all the associated horror stories about rental companies. I was extremely impressed with the cleanliness of my villa and the overall condition of the grounds. All in all, I highly recommend this property and wouldn't hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - free tickets is a wasted morning”
Reviews.Author: Leslie J
Reviews.Content: The resort is off US 192 along a side street and I can confirm that you really need a car to appreciate the resort and teh surrounding districts of Kissimmee. The layout of the apartment is excellent as we went as two couples on a fisrt floor apartment towards the rear of the complex. There was adequate parking spaces and within the unit a good selection and of resonable quality of appliances. One good point is that the unit has its own washing machine and tumble drier unlike other resorts where a community room is often provided and you have to pay. The resort seems to be geared more for the older group of clients as there was limited childrens facilities which is not a problem of course as the resort is on the doorstep of Disney. The only downside is the tempting offer of free tickets to some attractions etc. it is okay if you want to waste a morning as you have to go down the road to yes a 'timeshare sales' pitch. I am okay with this personally as I do not want to buy anymore weeks , points etc. but to a not so savvy client the advice is to try and stay clear of any offers that are made they are on a reducing cost i.e. expensive first then special deals for you then a one-off that is not going to be available if you come back later. All the common sales tactics of course. I know i wasted 2 hours of my vacation but at least I got 4 tickets to Arabian Nights for $54 for the encounter

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: MikeBee7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family (four of us) for two weeks at the beginning of September. I was incredibly impressed with the complex and our appartment was perfect. I would have preferred to have not been on the ground floor for the views, but as it happened, it worked out perfectly with four very large, very heavy suitcases to lug to the car at the end of the stay! The site was well organised and easy to navigate. Despite being very quite, the pool was the perfect place to chill out and relax. It was rather small, and I can see how this would be a complaint in the height of the season, however we very often had the pool area to ourselves! The jacuzzi at the pool and just behind our building was a stroke of genius - perfect for relaxing after a hectic day at the parks. Speaking of which, Kissimmee is a wonderful place to stay. The several times before that we have visited Florida, we've always played it safe and stayed on I-Drive, but from now on, i'm pretty sure Kissimmee will be the way forward. The distance to the Disney parks is nothing at all, and not even 10 minutes by car. Universal is a little further away, but still, very simple to get to. The security checking every car that enters the resort was comforting and always very friendly. One thing I will say - when you check in, take the opportunity to go and talk to the vacation planner accross from reception... You do have to go to a pretty hefty talk on buying time-share, but believe me - the offers and discounts they give you are WELL worth it. We managed to get $100 off admission to Seaworld!! All in all, I can't think of a bad point to this place. Nothing worth complaining about, anyway! The appartments were spacious and more than well enough equipped. The air conditioning system was fantastic and the advantage of having two (HUGE) bathrooms was brilliant in the mornings! It's 100% what we were looking for, everything it says on the tin. Its proximity to amenities (Supermarkets, malls, the parks, restaurants, everything) was perfect and i'd recommend it to anyone. Thank you to the Polynesian Isles.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: freedom982
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this place super clean I am a very clean person and after staying at the Ramada maingate(disgusting hotel stayed there due to a timeshare meeting I booked never again) we arrived here on 8/15/11 and stayed in bldg 11 so quiet and clean was very nervous at first after being in a dirty hotel previously but once I opened the door i was so happy. pool was clean whenever I asked for extra supplies I got them also it's in a great area very close to Wal-mart right down the street. All in All will definetly go back next year. P.S don't listen to the bad reviews trust me if i say it is clean it has to be as I am compulsive in cleanliness!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: TravelingOYEster
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as I had a trial for a time share. The 2 bedroom condo was just fine. It was spacious and clean. I would have preferred if there was someone who came to tidy up. I guess that why this place is inexpensive. Also, I asked for good seafood restaurants - I was told Red Lobster or Olive Garden. Ummm - we ended up doing our own research on good eats. We also asked for good shopping - we were sent to a less than impressive area with terrible shops. Last, we wanted to go to the beach for a day. We thought cocoa beach. They suggested Clearwater. 2.5 hours later, we finally arrived. It was beautiful, but not worth it just for a day trip. If you have family and want a place to have breakfast and rest your head - then this is for you. If you want a little more than that - stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: bluebug8090
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our daughter & 5 yr old grandson. The accommodation was great, plenty of space with 2 bedrooms & 2 bathrooms. Beautiful grounds with a nice pool. Location very convenient for Parks & shopping. Will definitely use again!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and spacious but only one problem”
Reviews.Author: tye w
Reviews.Content: The villa is very clean and spacious. The kitchen was awesome, they offered many pots and pans to use if you needed to prepare meals. There rugs were very clean and my children did not mind sitting on the floor or walking on the rugs without slippers. the beds were extremely comfortable they could use a better fitted sheet but the beds felt great. The hotel supplied you with enough towels and garbage bags durning our stay which are really needed when traveling with kids and cooking meals. The only complaints are the pool is very small but ok and we saw 2 large waterbugs. One when we arrived which was dead and another durning our stay. I complained to management and the offeres to place us in another room. I didnot fault the hotel for this issue as they have many guess who come and go. they responded and we were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, convenient, quiet, close to sites Isles”
Reviews.Author: kgray_hoosier_hayday
Reviews.Content: Booked this gem on Hotels.com this spring when I stumbled on a weekend special for our July trip to WDW. While a time share complex, Diamond apparently makes available a certain number of rooms to "outsiders". Having read the reviews, we spent time between landing at MCO and checking in at 4 p.m. given those who mentioned they don't fancy to early arrivals. Check in was quick and easy, and front gate security was spot on. Our second floor two-bedroom suite was clean although it's starting to show a tad bit of age. We had a room key that wouldn't open the shared laundry door outside our room, but maintenance did make an effort to remedy that. We were gone nearly all the time at WDW, so we didn't 1) use their swimming pool and other amenities, and 2) reply to ongoing phone messages to try to get us to go on their sales pitch tour of some other Diamond property...thank goodness! Nevertheless, we'd stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Trip with Grandkids”
Reviews.Author: Beachbabyny01
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Polynesian Isles Resort. I exchanged my RCI week in December to be able to bring my Grandkids to Disney! What a great time. The resort was good, but not great. There was plenty of room for 3 adults and 4 children. The unit could use some updating. New carpet is needed. Swimming pools and hot tubs were nice, and stayed open until mid-might, so we could go for a nice swim after a long day at the park. The location a perfect. Super Walmart is very close by, and lots of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “A true hidden treasure!”
Reviews.Author: lugoh20water
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect due to the limited photos on the web. When you arrive you'll notice it has a real polynesian feel at first. Once you enter your villa. "We rented a 2 bedroom" we were completely blown away. It is beautiful. The bedrooms the living room and especially the kitchen and dineing room. We thought they gave us a model for viewing in era. The grounds are well kept. They have grills throughout the property. Tennis, small basketball court,kid playground and so much more. Very family oriented. No tiki bar here. So if your looking for a place to relax and take in the sites. This is it. The pools are well maintained. Everything here was perfect. They should get a higher star rateing. reasonably priced. I hope my photos help.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing break, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jayyay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days. On check-in there was a problem with our booking, the travel agent had spelt my name wrong. The receptionist found the booking and changed the details quickly with little fuss. After check-in we were sent over to a separate desk where a quite friendly man tried to get us to come to a free breakfast where he would give us $100 for nothing, or a free holiday worth $700. It was obviously a timeshare/holiday club selling event, but he wouldn't admit to this. This is the only negative I have about the hotel, they rang us in our room a few days later trying again. The villa's are spacious and clean. Ours was a one bedroom but the lounge was still big enough for a family. It also still had two full bathrooms. The full kitchen had a stove, microwave, coffee maker, fridge/freezer with ice maker. There was also a washer/dryer and dishwasher. A small amount of washing powder and dishwasher detergent was provided. There was a safe which you'll need to collect the key from reception. I can't fault the villa in any way, spotless and everything working. TV and DVD were also provided. There was a balcony with sun beds and chairs protected by a insect/sun screen. Free wireless internet worked well. The complex had 2 swimming pools and at least 3 spas, the pools were well maintained and of a good size. There was also a couple of lakes with water features. The property is protected by security at the main entrance. Good location for eating out and getting to Disney, slightly further for Universal but still only 15- 20 minutes away. The road it's on is very quiet and has a Walmart about 3/4 of a mile away. Would definitely come back here, the value is great. Just avoid the timeshare/vacation club guys in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Najcia
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice, rooms spacious, nice grounds. The pools rather small but fine. Customer service non existent, very pushy and unfriendly sales staff pushing to set up a condo sale session during your stay. The worst part was trying to get some help after our son left a camera charger in the room. Phoned 3 times, never got a helpful answer and no one called back as promised. Finally, called the 4th time once got back home and was told that nothing was found in the room even though our son realized that he left the camera charger and battery in the power outlet 2 hours after we left the hotel and I called immediately. After days of waiting and calling, we received a dishonest answer and no apology or any helpful suggestion was offered. So much for honesty and courtesy. Overall, would not stay there because of complete lack of customer care and service.

Reviews.Title: “Homely!”
Reviews.Author: redali
Reviews.Content: A lovely resort. Appartments are well equipped and decorated.The master bedroom has a huge en-suite bathroom with whirlpool bath and separate shower. Pool is the warmest I have ever used and was never crowded. Nice sunbeds, available in the shade if required. Security on the gate which was welcomed. A great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Not the standard we had expected”
Reviews.Author: Jeskie
Reviews.Content: "Diamond or SPN" thats the question. Polynesian Isles seems to be managed by SPN and the grounds and reception are owned by ? Diamond.....confusing. Grounds lovely however in the two weeks that we stayed I cant recall the pool being cleaned and I was awake for 7am each morning. Rooms very dull and drab and at times damp. They have everything you need however dont expect a change of bedding or towels every other day as that doesnt happen. We got a change of linen after our 8th day. On arrival I removed a soiled quilt and placed in the wardrobe and when the beds were changed the soiled quilt was put back on! The apartment has to be left the way you found it, dishwasher has to be left on, air con set on leaving at a certain temp and beds not to be stripped just pulled back......i do hope they beds get changed. Apartments in need of a revamp in comparison to others I have stayed and wont be rushing back to this one. This is our third visit to Orlando and loved it just as much as the first time. Would recommend Cracker Barrell in Kisimmee and Chillis. Bahama Breeze also great however be aware of the 18% tip automatically included in the bill for parties over 6 and that was for cold food! Please visit Celebration which is a lovely town but dont eat at Shannons, very basis. If you golf visit LBV, Osprey Ridge, Mariott Grand Pines all very good. If a lover of shopping visit Prime Outlet top of International Drive (Ugg shop) great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: vivvy54
Reviews.Content: We were moved here after a bad experience at Cypresse Pointe; what a contrast! From the moment we arrived at reception until we checked out, we were made to feel so welcome, mega praise to the staff here. Our request for a top floor room was granted, although there are no elevators we had lots of help with our luggage. The 2 bed apartment is spacious, very clean and comfortable, with free wifi. A big screened balcony with fan helped us enjoy the lovely view of the lake, fountain and grounds (complete with ducks and squirrels). Those ground staff never stop working! The bed was very comfy, top quality linens etc. Kitchen is well equipped, and a washer & dryer were in a key carded closet just outside our front door. The pools were very clean and well maintained, and we kept coming across hot tubs hidden in the greenery around the resort, lovely. It was so peaceful we didn't feel as though we were just yards away from H192, and all the parks etc. are close. There's a 24 hour Walmart minutes away in the other direction, very handy. Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “For the money can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Terry2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks in Florida; 1 week here and 1 week at another, more expensive resort. To do it again, I would have stayed both weeks at the Polynesian Isles! Rooms are large, well furnished rooms with full kitchen. The grounds are well kept and nicely landscaped and the pools are even open late so you can swim after a day at the theme parks. Even had free internet in the rooms too. We loved the place and will come back on our next trip to Florida. The only change I would suggest is to provide a separate bin for recycling; so much of went into the trash was paper and plastic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice timeshare condo, super close to WDW”
Reviews.Author: embee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 2 bedroom (one USKing, 2 USTwins in second bedroom, pull out couch in living room) while on a family trip to WDW. This is a NO ELEVATORS resort, and will only take requests, no guarantees for first floor rooms. As the resort was fairly full, we were on the 2nd floor, and despite asking every day for a first floor move, they were not able to move us. As well, the front desk doesn't manage anything like that. You have to call the 1-800 from your room, they authorize the change, and they will notify the front desk. Lovely landscaping, none of the buildings are far from a pool, and there are a couple of hot tubs also on property...and they are hot! Pools are lovely as well, nice pavers on the deck, ample pounders, chairs and a few tables with umbrellas, and the pool is heated. Washrooms by the pools were very clean. Rooms are updated, just like the pictures, and well outfitted. Laundry is shared between the two units per floor. Basically there is a washer and dryer in an outdoor closet on your floor. You open the closet door with your room key. No one else's room key will open your laundry closet. The laundry closets are not located within the units. The laundry closets are on the landing between the front doors of each of the units that share. Hope that makes sense! There is a screened balcony with another room key coded exit/entry off the balcony. Easy to get to WDW, the Super Walmart is just a couple of blocks away, as is Publix, Target, CiCis and the Outlets. Friends of our stayed in a third floor unit...they are the ones with the cathedral ceilings in the living room. Internet was accessible within the unit using the sign in information provided...no additional charge. Perfect for our week of shopping, sun and fun with the family!

Reviews.Title: “Very Raalaxing - Beautiful Landscaping”
Reviews.Author: ntsammy5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last Christmas and had a wonderful time. The units are huge and very functional. The location is great and we enjoyed it more than Bonnet Creek.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: pr_littlemermaid
Reviews.Content: This is a time share, be ready to be invited to a 90 mins presentation. And they will offer you free stuff if you go. There is WI-FI in rooms, a plus. Just call front desk and ask for code. Excellent security (gated). Pools are small, but Ok. I do believe they are heated. They had music all day long in the pool area. Rooms are very nice and spacious. We stayed in Phase IV and had Jacuzzi in Master Bedroom. We had 2 rooms + 2 full bathrooms + sofabed+ screened balcony + wetbar + TV's in one of each rooms, including one on the living room. Beds were comfortable. Full Kitchen was excellent with all utensils you need to cook (a plus, it saves you money). Room was very clean. Furniture was out-dated but OK. TV's are old but OK. Washer/Dryer in between the 2 rooms of your floor. You'll get a starter kit with detergent, dryer sheets, dish soap, no sponge, coffee with sugar packets, no tea. Basic toiletries-shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bar soap, makeup remover wipes. Towels for 6 people. Check-out is at 10AM, and be sure to return the key on-time, if not, they will charge you $25 for every 15 mins late. There are couple of things you must do before leaving like turn the A/C to 73 degrees, remove all trash and place in one the big trash bins outside, soiled dishes must be placed in dishwasher, all soiled towels must be placed in laundry basket, etc...There is no elevator. Ask for 1st floor if you have to. Check-in was after hours, but security guards took care of everything. The guy at front desk was very nice and the timeshare lady, but the check-out lady, sorry, she was not very nice. Guards and maintenance people were very polite. Parks and shopping are close. Just a short drive. There is a Walmart very close, a Publix, Target, Outlet, and more. Very close to 535 (easy access to International Drive, restaurants, Downtown Disney and more). Definitively you'll need a car if staying in here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! Tropical, lovely landscaping and finely appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: thearys
Reviews.Content: Feels like you're in Hawaii as you walk through the complex. Then, upon entering the room, you find a gorgeous tropical flower centerpiece on a finely set dining table. It just gets better from there. Fantastic huge room, kitchen, large screened patio / balcony, georgous landscaping throughout resort, very nice pools, 5 hot tubs throughout property. This was the best and certainly most "attractive" place we stayed in several years - better than many resorts we've stayed at in Hawaii. Highly recommend you choose this over other properties in the area - it is not as close to Disney and amusement parks as say, Cypress Point - but the complex is more secure, and wow, what a nice place. Staff was polite and friendly also. Only complaint: the very sad BBQ grill - just an iron grate for charcoal as you'd find in a city park. They should invest is some nice barbeque equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great grounds, pool and room!”
Reviews.Author: kprieb
Reviews.Content: This place was great. I read most of the reviews before we left for Florida and they were good but of course you have a few people who have had a bad experience. Once we pulled up, there was a guard at the gate. I really like that feature. Someone is montioring the gate at all times. The check in was quick, no problems and they have a ton of activities planned for you. That is if you want to join in. We didn't just because we had a busy schedule. We were in Building 7, on the bottom floor, right across from the pool. Great location!! We booked our room through Expedia and got a great rate! The room was great. Like home away from home. Very nicely updated, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen and living room. We had 2 twin beds in one room and a king bed in the other. The jacuzzi tub in the master bath was awesome after long, busy days. We really liked having a kitchen. There is a super Walmart right down the street and we purchased drinks and pizza to make. Saved us lots of money! There are two pools on the grounds. I never actually saw the second pool and there were many hot tubs. We actually had one right out our backdoor! I really don't have a negative thing to say about the place. I would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Polynesian Isles”
Reviews.Author: ml13204
Reviews.Content: My wife and 12 yo grandson stayed at Polynesian Isles the last week in April, 2011. Don't be put off by my "four stars". The only downside is to me it was off the beaten track. To compensate it was located between International Drive and the Rte 192 strip. Check in was effortless, reservations made througth Expedia. After that I was directed to the desk across the lobby to get directions to local supermarkets since we rented a two bedroom condo with kitchen. At this second desk I learned that this is actually a time share property. After a more or less pleasant 10 minute conversation where I made it clear we were not interested in a 90 minute presentation we went to our unit and were never approached again. We had a two BR, two BA unit on the third floor (no elevators). It was beautiful, comfortable and fully equipped. It had a hair dryer (important to my wife) and beach towels for the pool. The master bath had a nice corner shower, double sinks and a whirlpool. We had a beautiful view of palm trees and tropical foliage from our screened deck. Right next to our door was a laundry room equipped with a free washer and dryer. Just across the driveway was our pool - one of two on the property. In the pool area was a hot tub, just the thing after a long day walking at the attractions, two tiki huts for shade, many comfortable lounges and, "super bonus" , restrooms. Next to the pool area was a pond with a fountain and a very nice waterfall feature - all very tropical. By the way, I counted four hot tubs on the property, a small playground, shuffleboard and tennis courts. The clubhouse has a few video games, a pool table and "super bonus" two free internet ready computers with free printing. We used these to print our boarding passes, thus saving check-in time at the airport.. If you're interested, they don' t recycle, everything goes in the dumpster. Maybe it's "single stream"? There is a security gate at the entrance; you must stop and check in with the security guard. before proceeding. Workers were everywhere, pruning and preening; the grounds and buildings were well cared for. One minor disappointment to report. There were several tiki huts with barbecue grilles around the property. Unfortunately, to us anyway, they are all charcoal. There are no gas grilles. We loved Polynesian Isles; we will certainly consider it next time we go to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Value and location is good!”
Reviews.Author: Texassun
Reviews.Content: We had the 2 bedroom villa - it was nice having the two bathrooms - made getting ready in the morning easy. You stay here to save some money due to the full kitchen - you can either prepare your snacks for the parks or enjoy a meal in your room -- free washer and dryer is very nice -- pool area felt like a resort, I have stayed on Disney property and no it is not as conv or as fun -- but this worked for us 2 adults -- a 24 year old and grandma. Beds are comfy, enjoyed the porch and hot tub and the pool is open till midnight! Rooms are dated, but had everthing you need. they are getting dy activities - build a bear - spa treatment - ice cream social etc. you need a car to stay here or taxi service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: SteveBarry
Reviews.Content: We own timeshares in Maui and used our points to stay here. Everything was very clean. There are 2 pools that are open until midnight and very clean and convenient to the rooms. Parking was not a problem as in other resorts. We have stayed at their other resort, Grand Beach and like this one much more. Nothing wrong with Grand Beach, just this was more conveinent. I only wish they had elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I expected”
Reviews.Author: TDAVIS44
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying what my guidelines for ratings are for these kind of places. We have stayed at many Marriott resorts in Orlando, Hilton Head, and Myrtle Beach. I rate them anywhere from 4-4.5 stars. This place is definitely not up to par to any of those, however its not all bad. Our room was on the 1st floor. First impression was that it was very dark not sure if it was because we were on 1st floor or not. No big deal, just turn all the lights on. Some parts of the rooms were a little worn and showed some age. Bathrooms were nice with a stand up shower and whirlpool tub in master and a tub/shower combo in other bathroom. Kitchen was nice and seemed stocked with about everything you would need to cook. There is a big table for dining for 6. Tv's were lacking. No flat screens and a 14" in master. Again, no big deal, but a lot of little things do add up. The bed in master was king size and very comfortable. The bed in other bedroom was only a double which could be an issue if it is to be used by another couple instead of kids. There is a free washer and dryer outside the front door that is shared with other unit on the same floor. The pool areas were adequate if not exciting. Both pools ranged in depth from 3 to 6 ft and were heated. There was a hot tub in each pool area plus 2 others. There is a 1 rim basketball court and 4 shuffleboard courts. Also a small playground. There are grills, but surprisingly, they are all charcoal. The gym is pretty pitiful for a place of this size. A treadmill, step machine, and a universal weight machine in disrepair. One odd thing going on there is that the front desk is where you check in, but the rest of your requests go through someone else. Supposedly there is some kind of lawsuit in progress. Had 1 interaction with management and it did not go well. Upon check in we had 2 garbage bags and 2 packets of dishwasher detergent. Called on Wednesday to have more of each brought to unit and they said to stop by office and pick them up. They handed me 1 garbage bag and I had to ask for 2 additional so that I wouldn't have to comeback. They then said that the 2 dishwasher detergent packs were part of a welcome package and there is a 50 cent charge for any additional packets. I refused to pay it because we were required to put all dirty dishes in dishwasher and run a cycle to clean them upon departure. They gave me 1 packet free, but that says a lot about this place. Overall, if you can get this place for $79 a night as someone there said they did, it would be worth it. But, we exchanged our timeshare for this and it did not meet expectations. My guess is that anyone that rates this place 4 or 5 stars is either used to hotels or got it at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, no pets, a few issues, nice staff & location, good gym”
Reviews.Author: Catamariner
Reviews.Content: We came here for convenient access to Universal Orlando with excellent comfort at a reasonable cost. We stayed here a week, in a 2nd-floor unit. The rate was very good, the space was excellent, 2 BR/2 BA with full kitchen, dining area and LR with a screened balcony. The place was quiet and if had been warmer (there was a cold snap a couple of weeks before Christmas), we would have enjoyed the screened balcony overlooking the landscaped communal area (all the balconies overlook such areas instead of overlooking the parking lots. Good planning!). The free washer and dryer behind the doors on the landing between the two units was quite welcome. The karaoke party was great fun, midweek. The gym was surprisingly well-appointed, with a universal-style machine with multiple stations, although the small bar and one of the leg curl pads was missing (the large lat pull bar was present); I reported this and they noted it, so it may be replaced by now. We had one small maintenance problem (the lock on the doors to the washer-dryer got stuck), and when we reported it during the day (not after hours), someone came out to fix it immediately. The only drawback (and for some people this will be huge) was that for the first two days, we had to deal with bugs. There were very small black beetles in the master BATHROOM (which was huge and has a lovely corner with a jacuzzi); they would show up on the floor from the shower across to the toilet when it was dark, and there was one actual normal-sized roach on the bathroom wall the second night, all of which which we swatted and disposed of. Scarier for the non-southerners, the second evening there was a palmetto bug in the entryway near the small bedroom (these look like the biggest roach in the world, but they are slow-moving and normally live outdoors, so they will think they are hidden when they are under an electric cord, even though they show out both sides -- easy to kill, in other words, and PBs are usually not a sign of "infestation." None of these bugs was in the kitchen, which was clean. My guess is that the unit was untenanted for a week or two before we arrived and that spraying elsewhere in the building drove a pregnant roach into our area, so the tiny beetles were probably a recent hatch, and who knows, maybe that was "mom" on the wall. I do know there were no roach droppings in the undersink area or on any surface that was inspectable; yes, I checked all of the undersink areas and shelves after finding the bugs. The bed was clean and the linens were fresh, and as I mentioned, the kitchen also was clean and had no roach sign. Palmetto bugs usually stay outdoors, and the one we found was during a cold snap, near the outer door, so may have been trying to come in for shelter.

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped, clean condo in a quiet, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: bridgenut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights as a timeshare exchange in villa 7, condo 31, opposite the swimming pool. Spacious, well-equipped, clean, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. There was a starter pack of washing powder, washing liquid, coffee, paper towel; plus small sizes of Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries in each of the bathrooms. Tropically furnished, granite counters and very large modern master bathroom and 2nd bathroom, with good shower pressure. Wifi connection available with password (which was on a card in the unit) I don't know about television reception 'cos I never turned any of the 3 tvs on. My only problems were: king bed in master was (for me) extremely firm; unit was very dark due to foliage outside the lanai and position of the unit. It was also on the 3rd floor with no elevators, which wasn't a problem for me, but could be for some (I helped a neighbour who was trying to negotiate the stairs with a twin stroller!) I was attending a conference at the nearby Marriott world center hotel and didn't use any of the amenities of the resort - except for information from the guest services reps, who were very helpful and DID NOT try and hard-sell timeshares (just told about the "welcome" get-together)...... All-in-all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Florida's best kept secret....beautiful and relaxing resort !”
Reviews.Author: WendyRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week with our three children ages 3,11, and 13. I picked this resort based on the reviews I read here. I wanted a place close to all the theme parks, yet quiet and relaxing. We also wanted two bedrooms and not a one room hotel set up. The Polynesian Isles resort was ideal. Only 10 minute drive to all theme parks. Landscaping was gorgeous and tropical. Soft music playing at the pools. 4 hot tubs scattered about the resort, one right behind our condo with steps off of our second floor place to it. My children loved the pool and hot tubs as well as the basketball court and playground. They played pool in the activity room. All kinds of board games,basketballs, and books could be borrowed from the game room. The rooms were beautifully decorated. Granite countertops and showers. The sheets were so soft ( the thread count must have been 1,000 thread) and the beds were very comfortable. I felt very safe and security was always guarding the front gate.The washer and dryer was in a room right outside the front door to your room, which was great that you didn't have to hear them going. The best part was FREE WIFI in your room. It was fast and had no problems with it. LOVE, LOVE , LOVE this resort and will be back. There were a fair number of people there , but really quiet and peaceful (what all parents want after a day at the theme parks with screaming kids.)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise - much nicer than expected”
Reviews.Author: toystorymama
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at Polynesian Isles with my husband, our two young sons (3 and a newborn) and my father in a 2 bedroom condo. The resort was lovely. The bathrooms and kitchen in our unit were particularly nice with the granite countertops and nice cabinets and a large jacuzzi tub in the master. The resort was very quiet and we all slept well in the comfortable beds. The location is great too - about 15 minutes to any Disney park and lots of restaurants, shopping and Old Town within a mile. The day we checked out we realized we had left my son's precious "blankie" behind. Terribly worried we rushed back to the resort where we found they had already stripped our room. Two members of the staff immediately rushed to help and found "blankie" in the hotel's laundry room. We were so relieved and I was so impressed at the kindness of the staff. My son gave the nice staff member a big hug. We would definitely return to Polynesian Isles and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff. Beautiful grounds.”
Reviews.Author: dlowie
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an eight night stay at this resort. The location is convenient to Disney parks, shopping and eating establishments. The condos are nicely furnished and roomy with very comfortable beds. The pools are small ,but nice and each has an adjacent hot tub. I had car trouble while a guest and one of the maintenance staff (Felix) stopped by to give me a hand. We have stayed at several resorts in Kissimmee through the years including Disney resorts, but this is one of our favorites. Stay here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Polynesian Isles Resort, now known as Diamond Polynesian Isles”
Reviews.Author: JoyceRosharie
Reviews.Content: Resort was very nice. The size was just right, facilities were clean and very nicely decorated

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room, wasn't bad, but a little tired”
Reviews.Author: TFry55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at resort as a swap with another time-share property. Located adjacent to a residential neighbourhood. Stayed in unit 1224, spacious - two-bedrooms, 2 bathrooms (jacuzzi in master); wet bar sink in living/dining area; full-sized fridge and stove; washer/dryer just a step outside front door; screened-in patio, although it would be too small if more than 2 people wanted to sit outside, and a full table would have been nicer than the small coffee table that was there, should we have wished to have a meal outside; security at the gate were always very friendly and welcoming; pools were clean and lots of lounge chairs nearby. Of course, we were there at low season. Service staff attended to our needs quickly. No restaurant on-site, had to drive for groceries; no internet access in room, although there used to be in a previous life, there was wifi access in business centre and adjacent patio; beds in second bedroom were hard; TVs outdated and living room couches were "tired". We noticed that grounds security was rather light: instead of walls around the grounds, there were climbable fences, or bushes that had gaps between them (sparce in some areas). Playground outdated and small, tucked away into a small corner of the property. The time-share coordinator was a bit pushy, but we didn't go on the tour anyway. Her, we could have done without. If I recommended this place, I would make sure that people knew it's a bit more than walking distance from a restaurant or from groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Keeps getting better!”
Reviews.Author: SaKon
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a 2 week stay at the Polynesian Isles in Kissimmee. We last stayed there in 2008 (we have a timeshare and it is our home resort). I am continually impressed by this resort. The condo units have seen some nice updates. Both the master bathroom and the smaller bathroom have been updated in granite counters, new dark wood trimmed mirrors and light fixtures. Condos are very large and spacious. The resort has new pool side loungers, tables, chairs and umbrellas. All the staff are very friendly and work hard to keep the resort looking great. The kids enjoyed both pools every day. It is nice to have the full kitchen and laundry so you don't have to eat every meal at a restaurant which gets old very fast. Resort is nice and quiet. No issues with loud people/parties. Lots of families, couples, and seniors at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Week in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: sanibeltravler
Reviews.Content: The condo was spacious and updated furnishings/bathrooms. Kitchen was older, but certainly fine. My request to be on the first floor was not honored nor did the front desk seem to have recevied the voicemail or the email I had sent. It's a bit confusing because evidently the front desk is Diamond Resort, but the property is managed by another company. I had to keep contacting one or the other depending upon what the question was. They did offer complimentary newspaper each morning. As I had planned on doing work while I was there, the biggest disappointment was that there was no internet availability in the condo. I had to spend hours each day in the clubhouse to access the wireless internet. At 8 PM, it closed and I had to sit outside to use the wireless internet. I would not have booked this property had I known I would not high speed internet available in the condo. However, if this is not important, the property was fine. This location was near many restaurants and shopping. I would not return here unless they had internet in the condos.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: pinky0208
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for about 5 days. I found this online at an excellent price. We were a little nervous at first. My husband was on business and was in Orlando before we arrived. He went to the Polynesian to see the resort in advance. He tried to get into a room but was told that was not their policy. Most places in Orlando are happy to let you see their resort if it is not fully occupied. He took us by the resort when we arrived and my first reaction was that it looked like an apartment complex. Not the mega structures you see in Orlando but we had booked it and were hoping for the best. We checked in with a wonderful lady at the front desk. My husband did say that when he called the resort that he was not impressed with the people on the phone so it was a nice surprise to be checked in by someone nice. She gave us a room on the second floor of a two floor building. We went up and crossed our fingers. We were very surprised and happy with what we saw. The condo was very large. Nice, full kitchen, washer and dryer, big master with a very nice updated bath (no large tub in the master but a really nice shower). Second bedroom with 2 twin beds (no T.V. in second bedroom). Full second bath also updated with a tub/shower combo. Living room was nice and very clean. Dining room table was set like guests were coming for dinner. All the dishes, utensils, pots and pans were nice. We also had a welcome pack in the room with coffee, laundry soap etc... Most resorts do not provide this. The resort seemed empty during our time there. We had the pool all to ourselves and it was just a very peaceful place to be. We didn't miss all the bar activity by the pool or having a resort so packed with families it was hard to hear yourself. We hope to be able to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: marice755
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised how nice it was. We had a two bedroom unit, it was very clean, things had been updated, new beds which were very comfortable. Kitchen and bathrooms had been updated. Everyone was very friendly. Would go back anytime. Only things in our unit not updated were the televisions.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful surprise, lovely atmosphere and huge units!”
Reviews.Author: pantsonfire99
Reviews.Content: I shared this unit with my parents (the were there about three days longer than me) and we really loved it! The place was huge and well laid-out, both bedrooms had large baths attached, the kitchen and living room areas were spacious and the decor throughout was very nice and of good quality. We were on the ground floor and the landscaping was very well done. There are hot tubs hidden around the grounds and we had one right around the corner. The "Polynesian" decor throughout the resort consists of a few leaf-thatched roofs and tropical motifs, which makes it kind of fun and a little different from the ordinary. It's no Disney's Polynesian Resort, but it was quite nice in it's own regard. The master bedroom had a chaise lounge and an alarm clock radio that you can hook your ipod to (which was nice--I needed to charge mine.) On the whole, I'd love to stay here again. The grounds are nice and I don't remember being harassed by sales people. I was at Disney a lot anyway, and this is a good location to get to Disney quickly. A great trip overall! I highly recommend it, it felt quieter and off the beaten path than other places I've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Ygenien
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Polynesian Isles Resort on September 13-20 in a two bedroom villa. The lobby area was charming and the staff was very friendly. The outer appearance of the units appeared older however the landscape was beautiful. The first issue we had was that the key card did not work after two trips to the front desk to rekey the card; the maintenance man had to let us in the unit and fix the issue with the lock. The unit was spacious and appeared to have everything we needed to have a comfortable stay. Once I entered the master bathroom I noticed a dead roach on the floor. When I lifted the toilet seat I noticed that housekeeping did not clean the bathroom…there was a nasty ring around the toilet seat and lid. We cleaned the bathroom ourselves. There are three televisions in the unit; one in each bedroom and the living room the downside here is that the cable connection was fuzzy. Once we had our first meal in the unit we noticed that the dishwasher was broken. We hand-washed all of our dishes this was not a problem. After reading the checkout procedures I realized that housekeeping did the bare minimum to clean the unit. The towels, toiletries, and linen are replaced however it is the departing guest’s responsibility to clean the unit for the next guest. If any additional cleaning is necessary you will be charged for it. We liked that the resort is centrally located to Disney World and SeaWorld. There are great restaurants located near the resort as well. I think that this would be our first and last stay at the Polynesian Isles Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, centrally located to all attractions!”
Reviews.Author: ClampetsIreland
Reviews.Content: This resort has pools,tubs,tennis,basketball.bbq's and all set in a relaxing setting. Very good for families however it lacks an on-site bar or refreshment area. Only 10 mins from Disney and less than 90mins to Gulf coast. The rooms are generous however could do with more natural light inside.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here, would stay a third"”
Reviews.Author: EJSV
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Diamond Polynesian Isles, this was our second stay here in two years. Everything was clean, the grounds were immaculate. Very quiet .We stayed in the newer three level units this time. I liked the older two level units we stayed in two years ago better, only because they are a little bigger. Would stay here again. Very close to Disney, about 10-15 minutes from Sea World and Universal. Free WiFi next to the pool and in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Smaller Resort”
Reviews.Author: sns57
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week and we enjoyed the view from our balcony overlooking the lake. It is a smaller resort with free Wi Fi which is nice. They have some activities which you can participate in which is nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There is everything you would need in the units and the pool area has a very nice atmosphere about it.. Very nice pillow top matress and pillows. The hot tub is great after a hard day at the parks. The location is great as it is central to everything. There is a nice walking path around the lake which is used every day for the fitness walk. It is a great resort for both families and couples and seniors as it has something for everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Very well kept and upscale Gold Crown timeshare condo”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunandFun
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom second floor condo as an RCI timeshare trade. Arrival was early and early check in was allowed due to unit being available. Second floor (no elevator) with good parking near unit and good lighting at night outside. Unit furnished very nicely. Kitchen very well equipped. Nice towels and bath ammenities. Nice layout of unit. Would have slept 4 privately and 6 in total if living room hide-a-bed utilized. Three TV's and 1 DVD player. Two pools and 4 hot tubs, putting green, tennis courts, basketball court, shuffleboard, and clubhouse with game room and pool table. Near Disney and near I 4 to get to Sea World and Universal. Also very easy to get to Kissimmee and things such as Old Town, Green Meadows Petting Farm, many dining choices, Publix, and many other shopping choices. Despite the easy on and off to Highway 192 or Road 535 the "side street" location makes it very quiet. No road noise at all. Fully gated with very alert and attentive security. We had a small issue with the HVAC unit upon arrival however fixed promptly and very politely by maintenance staff. We had a larger issue with the WI FI service not working. Finally did get refund from this vendor and GM of resort told us new vendor was in process to avoid the WI FI outage we faced going forward. Overall a good place with just enough activies. Would be good for seniors, empty nest couples, or families. Not so large as some time share resorts but very safe and convenient. On site concierge desk to help with tickets and planning. Yes...we would return based on the service recieved and yes, we suggest you consider this facility in your future Orlando/Kissimmee visits. Having a condo with about 1600 sq. ft. of space and full kitchen is so much better than a simple hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnieMichelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept 5 & 6 in a two bedroom with my parents pre-Disney check in. The place was huge. Everything was clean and updated nicely. The pool was nice. Nicely landscaped. Everyone was very friendly. There were only a few other cars there. Not very many people there, ?maybe because the possible hurricanes. Not a mega resort. It is much smaller than the other Diamond resorts in the area. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: det312
Reviews.Content: Arrived week of 2/13/08-2/20/08. With wife, daughter and mother in law. plenty of space for all with two good sized bed rooms, two bathrooms wherein one was HUGE with a jacuzzi tub . The resort does not have a lot of activities but why should it when you are 10 min. from Disney, Universal and Seaworld. I did not come to Orlando to stay at a hotel! Very quiet at night with a polite staff and a guard at the front gate who checked our pass every night which is great for safety! I would stay here again and recomend it to anyone with family. Nice and clean and they even had a card under the bed saying "We clean here too! which I thought was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax...Close to all attractions.”
Reviews.Author: jericap
Reviews.Content: Check-in: The resort is located in a residential area but close to area attractions. It sits between Irlo Branson Hwy and Vineland. We arrived a day later than our check-in date and were immediately given our room to check in. We had to go to guest services to obtain our “parking pass” and a welcome gift. No welcome gift, just a pitch to attend a timeshare presentation for Grand Beach. We declined. There is a lobby with an activities room and a couple of outside areas in which you could pick up free Wi-Fi. Grounds: The resort has about 130 units with 2 heated pools, 4 hot tubs, tennis courts, shuffle board, playground, and putting green. Landscape around the area is neat, clean, and well maintained. We only went to the pool near our building. The pool is decent size, not huge, but it was heated and very clean with adequate seating. There are some tables with umbrellas and I would say that would be it for shade; not a lot of shaded areas. There is a security guard on duty 24/7 that checks all cars coming in. They also will give out keys to your unit if arriving later than 8pm. We left this morning at 5:30am and we gave him our keys for check out. Unit: We stayed in unit 1214 which is the last building overlooking the tennis courts. This was a timeshare direct exchange for us, so we did not receive any housekeeping services. There are no elevators in the buildings, but luckily we were on the first floor. Each building in Phase IV has 4 units on each floor but appears to separate slightly into 2 and 2. There is a washer dryer outside between each of the 2 units on each side, which is free. The unit itself is fairly large and has 2 bedrooms, 2 full baths, dining area, full kitchen, living room, and screened lanai. The kitchen has granite counters, full stove, fridge, and all appliances. The starter pack consists of 2 coffee packets, 2 tea bags, a small bottle of dish detergent, and 2 packets for the dishwasher and a box of clothing detergent. If anymore is needed, you can buy them for $.50 at the front desk. There are full salt and pepper shakers, paper towel and full service for 6-8 people. This kitchen has everything needed; nice set of pots and pans, including 3 nice fry pans. Sharp knives!! Very nice! The décor is nice with warms brown tones in the main living area and blues in the bedrooms. The carpet really needs to be replaced though as it is spotted and worn. Master bedroom has a Jacuzzi in the bathroom with a separate shower, chaise lounge which is great for reading and a comfortable bed. There is plenty of storage in both bedrooms for clothing. The second bedroom has twin beds with tub and shower. Both bedrooms have a 19” television in the rooms and the living room has a 25”. The living room consists of a sofa bed and 2 decent sized chairs with a cabinet which houses the TV and DVD/VHS player and also has drawers for storage. It appears use of the sofa bed would be tight to get around if opened. The dining area had adequate seating for six, as well as a breakfast bar which has seating for 3. You could purchase Wi-Fi in the room for 39.95 for 7 days, 21.95 for 3 days or 7.95 daily. However, if you choose to take your laptop to the area in back of the clubhouse, you could get it for free. No mid-week cleaning, towel exchange is done on Wednesdays if you put your dirty towels outside in the laundry basket by 9am. No charge for some local calls, but others with a prefix other than 396 or 397 were considered long distance and the charges for those are $1/first minute, .25/each add’t minute Activities: A complimentary newspaper is delivered every morning, board games can be checked out at the desk and a variety of books are available in the game room. There are also various sports equipment, such as basketballs, horseshoes, and such also available at the front desk. There are various tickets to all attractions available at guest services at a small discount. As far as activities for children, they took those out of our packet since we were not traveling with any kids; so I can’t comment on those. Overall: I would definitely come back to this resort; it is not too big and centrally located to everything. Disney is about 10 minutes away, SeaWorld about 15 minutes away. It is very close to restaurants. The only thing I did not care for was that the unit was kind of dark. It may have been the location of the unit, or the screened lanai, but the living room and kitchen were quite dark. The bedrooms were okay with adequate daylight, it was just the main area that was dark. There was however, great artificial lighting in the units. The other thing was there was a terrible odor in the unit. I bought some Glade candles which worked well, but I didn’t realize they have an ozone machine which would have dealt with the odor. I would recommend this resort to others who would like to relax and be near all the attractions in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Stole my child's clothing!”
Reviews.Author: my2beautifulgirls
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney every year, and decided to stay at Polynesian this year. Since we drove this year, I packed a lot of clothing for my 2 girls. Well, as I was packing to leave, I noticed that half of my oldest daughter's clothes were missing! Many of these clothes were brand new- bought just for our annual trip. I went to the desk- the were no help. They pulled some "bogus" report and said no one had been in our room. They would not do anything about this! I went to the manager- same thing! They said their employees have worked there a long time, and would not steal anything from guests. We left there feeling disgusted and violated! We filed with the Florida BBB as well as sent a letter to the corporate offices of Polynesian- now called Diamond resorts...same thing. I will NEVER recommend or stay at this resort again. PLEASE think twice about staying here. If you do go, inventory everything you bring. They are sneaky and have probably been taking things for years.

Reviews.Title: “perfect, just be aware of the "presentation"”
Reviews.Author: errico
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 weeks here and it was really a nice relaxing place with pools and SPA's near by your apartment, with a nice bath in the apartment, lots of space, nice atmosphere with palm trees...really, NOTHING to complain except ONE THING: the customer relation desk near the reception will try to send you to a HORRIBLE place: they will tell you that there is a nice presentation where you can go and that everybody likes the place: you think it's a presentation of the Hotel Resort itself, to show you what you can do there and the activities within the hotel and perhaps outside, but NO, they will try to sell you and your partner "Time Share": properties, basically. And they will try very hard to get you to sign a piece of paper. I spent 3 of my precious hours feeling guilty that I did not want to buy a house there. Even if the guest service lady will tell you "you don't have to buy anything", believe me, it's hard not to. Really unpleasant. If you want to go there, just BE AWARE of that and ignore them when they try to hook you up to this presentation.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: peter191049
Reviews.Content: Great aircon ground floor appartment was spacious and easily accomodated 5 adults in 2 beds and sofa bed. Unit had 2 baths inc jacusi and well appointed kitchen dishwasher etc. Main living room about 30 foot long with small outside deck. laundry room adjacent. 2 nice pools with loungers, and bbq's, hot tubs etc Each morning sat outside in the sunshine and ate breakfast in the shady picnic areas under thatch. Easy 25 min access to Disney, Uiversal and attractions. Restarants walking distance. Up market, quiet clean and safe, friendly staff and helpful. Timeshare reps phoned once and were acceped we were not interested as already have too many weeks ! NB blocks are 3 storey and no lifts.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Resort”
Reviews.Author: chicy724
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 6 nights in building 11 and absolutely loved it. Perhaps we were so astounded because we originally put into Cypress Pointe for some reason when we booked a 1 bedroom Polynesian.. that place (cypress) was scary! We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom because I assume the 1 bedrooms were not available. Upon check in we were greeted by a very nice kitchen, dining and living area. It was all very nicely appointed and seemed rather updated. We had a nice kitchen with new appliances, granite and all amenities you would beed including a blender and mixing bowls. The master bedroom was cute, nice bright linens and window coverings. Though there was older-style furnishings, it was still wonderful. We had a really comfy chaise lounge-I want one at home now! The master bath was HUGE. We had a jacuzzi though we didn't use it. I love the double sinks and separate shower. The guest bedroom was a little older as far as the linens and such but still nice and adequate. The addition of a second bathroom for guests is a dream come true. We had my other half's Mother and Father visit for 2 days and it was great they could have their own space. The pools were great, as well as the jacuzzi's. Though the jacuzzi near the office was way too hot to go into. I tried and lasted all of 30 seconds. You have the option to pay for internet in the room, it is a separate company so don't get mad @ Poly.. it was $25 for the week or $5 a day. The lady @ the Desk (Michelle) was spectacular and told us we can just grab the office's internet for free within range. She was great at check in and told us about everything available to us on the property which I appreciate. I have been to so many hotels that just check you in, tell you which direction your room is and send you away leaving you in utter confusion. Every employee we came across, even driving by on the golf card waved to us. Everyone at the gate was very friendly as well and I love that it is a gated area. No one http://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/01/05/89/e0/kitchen.jpg http://media-cdn.tripadvisor.com/media/photo-t/01/05/89/e0/kitchen.jpggets in without a parking pass or guest name and info. The location is great for all attractions. We had gone to Sea World, Universal, Islands of Adventure, and Epcot and it was all within 15 minutes or so. The whole resort is very quiet, despite the herd or elephants above us for about 4 nights of our stay. I think their rooms are adequately sound proof, but these people were just jumping up and down, running across.. we tried and tried to figure out what on Earth they could be doing.. so I do not believe it is an issue with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Theywere mean to there workers!”
Reviews.Author: megaldon
Reviews.Content: I checked in everything was smooth front desk helped me with majority of my ?'s.my room was not clean and they actually gave me guff about it specially some guy named anthony he was a real jerk! and he was yelling and cursing at his workers in front of me i told him i could wait and there was no need to react that way but he kept on. Happy workers lead to a better service at a resort and the workers there dont look happy. kinda run like a slave ship one worker told me room are big but the supervisors suck.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that!”
Reviews.Author: caribdiamond
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the Polynesian Isles Resort on June 25, 2007. When we arrived at the resort at 3:30 pm. their was no rooms clean for us to check into. I had to leave my cell phone number at the front desk to call when a room was completely cleaned and ready for us. Ten minutes later I received a call that our room was ready. The room was okay but they said we would have a jaccuzzi but we didn't. Their are two pools and 4 spa tubs, the pools are quite small but the kids loved to swim in them. The spa tubs were so hot the water was unbearable. We had to just chalk it up and make the best of our stay. The ladies at the front desk were very courteous and helpful at all times. This is a timeshare resort, not one that I own but one that I was touring. It has no stores on the premises and no activities for adults. No swim up bar or nothing of the sort on the grounds. Activities are scheduled throughtout the day for the children for a nominal fee. Most places include this with your stay as you have already paid to stay and play. We had a good time but I do not recommend this place and will not be going back.

HotelInfo.Name: Diamond Polynesian Isles
HotelInfo.Address: 3045 Polynesian Isles Boulevard, Kissimmee, FL 34746 (Formerly Sunterra Polynesian Isles)
